description: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more Please note that this tent does not retain heat like a normal home- we have electric blankets and a mattress cover that guarantee that you are warm and comfy sleeping- but the rest of the tent will match the outside temp in the colder months. The bathroom is heated and stays toasty and so does the HOT TUB! :-D  ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. As of August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  We have been constantly upgrading this site since we offered Asheville's first set up tent rental in April of 2014! We are now pleased to offer our guests a luxury Bell tent fully furnished with everythi
name: Glamping w HOT TUB + AC!

description: Dorm bunks at BonPaul and Sharky's Hostel. We have a co-ed dorm, as well as female only dorm.  We have some offstreet parking behind the hostel and are located in a very safe neighborhood with plenty of free on-street parking.  Our front porch is awesome, with a porch swing.  Asheville public transit bus stop one block away.   Each room has 6 bunks and plenty of windows. Guests have access to all hostel amenities: full kitchen and bathrooms, wifi and internet, common area, book exchange, and cool international travelers. We are located in Historic West Asheville, walking distance to amazing restaurants, cafe's and pubs, grocery, and Asheville's River Art's District. Two private bathrooms are shared throughout the hostel. We are a traveler's hostel and therefore CANNOT BOOK TO AREA LOCALS. The bunk price is listed per bunk. For multiple people please be sure to adjust number of guest for correct price.
name: Mixed Dorm Bunk at BPS Hostel

description: Walk to restaurants and bars. Top floor of handcrafted home with vaulted ceilings. Large full bath with glass shower.  One queen bed and one twin. description: A sweet little log cabin in a nice neighborhood, 1.5 miles from West Asheville, 2.5 miles from downtown, and 1/3 mile from Carrier Park & The French Broad River.  (Host lives in the cabin during the week, so it is only available on some weekends.) The cabin is in a very quiet neighborhood very close to the main parts of Asheville.  The kitchen is equipped with full size stove, toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker, pots, pans, silverware, dishes, glasses, etc. You will have access to one bedroom, a living room, a kitchen, and a bathroom. If you need any help with what to do in Asheville or anything at all, I'm glad to help. The neighborhood is quiet, quaint, tucked away, and fairly wooded for being so close to town. There is wireless high-speed internet, but NO telephone.  Be sure to bring your cell phones.  If you need to borrow a charger, we can provide one for you.

description: This clean and bright West Asheville efficiency HOMESTAY is a convenient 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or Haywood Road, West Asheville; close to breweries, music venues and amazing restaurants. Located in a cozy and well kept older home (110 years old!), the apartment is a fully furnished bedroom (queen size bed), small kitchen and bath, with linens and towels provided and high speed wireless internet.   The best thing about this home is the location. You can see the downtown Asheville skyline from the side deck, but the back yard feels secluded and woodsy with tons of birds, cicadas at night and lightning bugs in the summer. In the winter, less green, but a nice view of downtown (especially at nighttime)!  You can walk under the highway to the Earthfare grocery store, a drugstore, deli and other amenities, or to Haywood Road, the main drag through West Asheville. description: Our cozy 2 bedroom sleeps 4 lucky folks. We are walking distance to a Greenway and bustling Haywood Rd in W AVL, and a short drive to all the major attractions!. Modern 1 Bedroom apartment with private entrance in Eco-Fabulous Home called the Nauhaus ((website hidden)), which was designed as a model for urban sustainability.  It features passive solar energy a living roof, and hemp-crete walls which make is cool in the summer and warm in the winter, and keeps the space extra quiet. Come experience the next level of 'Green Living' in one of America's first-ever HEMP HOUSES!!  Learn more about the design by Googling 'Nauhaus Institute'.   The apartment has 1 bedroom with a queen size bed and luxurious 10 inch memory foam mattress, a beautiful tiled bathroom, with bathtub and shower, a large living room with sitting area, full kitchenette, breakfast bar, an extra full size futon in case you have child
name: Gr8 Choice! Eco-AWEsome hOMe W AVL

description: Antique bed recently replaced with non-squeaking basic bed, as you will see mentioned in reviews. No shared wall with my room. Riverview is an awesome location in West Ash, very convenient to downtown and River District and interstate. My home is uniquely located close to West Asheville (walking distance), River Arts District (walking distance, though uphill on your way home!), and very close to downtown (about an $8 cab ride). Certainly can use the fridge, but cooking is off limits. Quite a lot if they want to, but most of my visitors have a busy schedule getting out and about in the heart of Asheville. description: Spacious, comfortable one-bedroom apartment on the lower/basement level of a two-story home. Though it's basement level, there's plenty of natural light through windows that face a wooded area. Short walk from "downtown" West Asheville. LGBTQ friendly.  Our downstairs apartment has its own private entrance and a nice view of the woods out back.  The apartment includes - A private bedroom with full-sized bed, closet - Bathroom with tub and shower - Kitchenette (two-burner stove, sink, and mini-fridge)  - Small table and chairs for dining/coffee/work - Couch and comfy chair in the living/yoga room.  We can blow up a full-sized aerobed if you have more than two people in your party, but ask for an additional $15/person for more than two guests.  We have wifi but no cable or television.  If you're staying two or more nights, you'll get a gift card for Sunny Point. All guests will have coffee, tea, creamer, and a mini-fridge full of local beer and wine available on the honor system.  Privat

description: Beautiful 1928 arts and craft bungalow in hip West Asheville. Rocking chair front porch and relaxing back deck. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, and playgrounds. Short drive to downtown Asheville and Biltmore. Main level bedrooms: one bedroom with queen bed and two bedrooms each with one twin bed. Basement bedroom has a full bed and bath. Guests can access any part of the house and yard except for the upstairs/attic area and garage. West Asheville is a wonderful, eclectic neighborhood and our house is within walking distance to many pubs, restaurants, and playgrounds. Our favorite places to go are Tacos Jalisco, Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack, Nine Mile, and West End Bakery. Walk to most places on Haywood Road in 10 minutes or take a short drive to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate. Please, please be kind to our wonderful cat Otto! Ample street parking and easy access to the highway. We renovated a basement apartment to create an independent guest space for travelers and friends.  It includes a functional kitchen and there is an air mattress for a potential third guest.  Some days, we are tempted to move down there ourselves, particularly during the summer.   We love our neighborhood.  It's walkable to Haywood and bikable to downtown.  Plus Asheville is a compact city, so you can get anywhere relatively quickly. We can provide a key for guests so they can come and go as they please.  We live on the floor above, so we are very accessible. We are open to whatever level of interaction that our guests prefer.  That said, Alyssa currently has a very busy work schedule, so she is normally a whirlwind flying in and out the door.

description: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more! Make your trip to Asheville extra memorable when you stay in our fun yurt :-) 5 miles from downtown and 2 to Haywood Rd on 2.5 acres alone (there are no other homes on this 2 plus acre property- the yurt sits alone here) Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pictures of our other sites and glamping adventures! Wait.....What's a Yurt?  A yurt (or ger) is a portable living structure originally developed by the nomadic groups of the Central Asian steppes. Original yurts were fashioned from local wood, felt, and braided horse hair. They were designed to be portable for moving as the horse and goat herds were driven across the plains. Strong and light, they could be set up in a day or so and properly equipped to withstand wind and snow that would crush many other dwellings. Modern yurts like ours are made from more contemporary materials (aluminum rivets, aircraft cable, and
name: Yurt! Asheville Glamping! Heat & AC

Sorry, though, cool weather makes the porches less functional. Guests may sit in kitchen for morning coffee/tea and homemade baked goods Tuesday-Friday or on porches in summer. We love to provide information and help, but can also respect quiet time. We are on the edge of West Asheville abutting a private school campus. At two miles distance are great cafes,restaurants and entertainment.  And of course, downtown Asheville has all that and more: 5 miles. Best if you have your own car, but Craig is an Uber driver. Our home is not child ready, and the room is available only for two adults, unless special arrangements are made in advance.
name: West Asheville Woodland Retreat

description: Come try something new and adventurous and stay at our yurt and enjoy the best of both worlds. You can feel a closeness to nature while not skimping on amenities as our yurt is outfitted with everything you need to have wonderful secluded retreat. Living "in the round" will give you tranquility that will stay with you well after you return home. One of our biggest selling points our yurt is that it is in a secluded location but you will only be 5-10 minutes from restaurants and groceries and 15-20 minutes from Biltmore and downtown Asheville or Black Mountain.  If you are looking for a hike the Mountains to the Sea Trail will be about 100 yards from your door. We have received some questions about a sulfur smell in our water that is mentioned in some of our reviews. We are happy to report that as of April 1, after extensive trouble-shooting we have remedied this problem.

description: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. description: Share my 5000 sq. ft. Fantasy Home 3500 ft high above the city  Mountain Views, Chef's Kitchen, Decks & gardens to meander in & do Yoga 5 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway & 10 to town I'm a senior with 2 loving pups, please come visit.......... I have a 5000 sq ft home on top of a mountain yet only 5 minutes away from one of the most famous scenic parkways in America and 10 minutes down to one of the unique towns in the USA: Asheville.  My home built in 2004, sits on almost 1 1/2 acres of almost flat land (rare in the mountains) with places to walk, practice Yoga, or just sit on the deck and read while enjoying the majestic mountains, or if lucky watch mama bear and her cubs walk the property.  Don't worry, no risk, as long as you stay away from the cubs. We're in a completely renovated 1940s stone-and-rock house within walking distance of UNCA. You will delight in your colorful, light-filled bedroom with a queen-sized sleigh bed, your own private half-bath, and a shared full bath. You are welcome to cook simple meals in our well appointed kitchen. We have a back porch to watch the sunset or drink your morning coffee. description: Bittersweet Cottage is a wonderful retreat from your everyday cares.  The one-bedroom cottage is located between downtown Asheville land the Blue Ridge Parkway.  We think it has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.  We hope you feel the same. Bittersweet Cottage is a self-catered free-standing accommodation. The location is ideal.  We are only 5 miles from downtown yet offer outstanding city and long-range mountain views.  You can listen to the sounds of the beautiful waterfall while soaking in your private hot tub, feed the koi in the pond and, well, just let it all go.   Guests have access to the 2 acre compound. description: My custom-built THOW sits just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville on the Weaverville line. It is bright and airy with a mountain view in the winter and beautiful woods on one side. It was recently featured on an episode of HGTV's Tiny House Hunters!! The house is 130 square feet plus sleeping lofts. It sits on an 18 foot trailer. I am usually around but even if I'm out of town I'm always available by text, phone, or e-mail. I call this kind of area "urban country" meaning that it's dark and quiet at night and has some of the quirks of the countryside but you can still see the neighbors' homes and have very quick access to any urban amenities you might want. The property is about 1 mile from Interstate 26...super easy access! The house is off of a private gravel road. You will occasionally have lights from a car or truck shine briefly into the windows of the tiny house as they pass by. Hot water tank is only 12 gallons so plan ahead for multiple users!!
name: Modern Tiny House on Wheels

description: Super cute bright, sunny bungalow. We love living here and imagine you will love it too! There is an awesome view of downtown and the river from our large picture window, a great place to cozy up to a cup of coffee. Artist appointed and decorated, our house is a great representation of the happy people we are.  Sunny living room and full kitchen, laundry, large master bedroom with high ceilings. There is a pull out sofa with a queen size mattress to accommodate extra guests. Wifi, Netflix and HBO go are available, not that you will have much time for TV. We live near the top of a hill in the town of Woodfin just north of North Asheville and one exit past UNCA. We love our street! It truly doesn't get much better. We feel just far enough from the hustle and bustle of downtown are less than 10 minutes from Downtown and the River Arts district. Four pretty rooms, with a separate entrance in our landscaped, picket-fenced backyard. Park in the adjacent drive, and enter from the private, covered, stone patio.  This is a daylight, walk-out basement apartment under our home. Living room has large TV with cable service.  Full kitchen has stove/oven, fridge, microwave, toaster, and Keurig-type coffee maker. The bedroom has a full bed.  The bath has a vanity with storage, and a walk-in shower, rather than tub.  The apartment has fresh paint, new carpet, and comfy towels and bedding.  Heat, A/C (window unit), and internet with wifi will make your stay comfortable. description: This beautiful cottage is on a quiet hillside, 2 m. N. of downtown. Enjoy the privacy of your own space: bedroom, living room, mini kitchen, bathroom, entrance & deck. Walk to trails, gardens, UNCA, trails, eateries & a breathtaking sunset/mtn view. Best of Both worlds...Nestled on a private dead end mountain road, yet only 2 miles from downtown...Experience Asheville's natural beauty by day and it's hopping nightlife easily from our beautiful home retreat.   The cottage is attached to our larger home, but has its own private entrance, balcony, bedroom, bathroom, mini kitchen and living room, as well as private off road parking.  There is a comfy queen size bed in the bedroom and a fold-out futon in the living room. 1-4 adults can fit comfortably. Kids are also welcome.   This is a legally permitted 'Homestay' by the city of Asheville. Our permit # can be found in the pictures. You will have access to your own space, including a mini kitchen with a large fridge/freezer, dishwasher, etc

It has approximately 800 sq.ft. of newly remodeled and upgraded living space. It is private and is located 100 ft or so from the main house where we live with our three boys. description: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (4)

Located on a quiet residential street halfway between downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate, this is the perfect getaway for those who want everything the beautiful and charming city of Asheville has to offer. This home features two master suites, one on the main floor and one upstairs.  Walk to the upscale shops and restaurants of Biltmore Village, or hop in your car or bicycle and get to downtown's world class restaurants and shopping in just a few minutes. You're a short drive from the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway, recreation on the French Broad River, countless hiking and mountain biking trails of Pisgah National Forest, charming towns of Western North Carolina, and the unique and vibrant culture of the Appalachians. description: Our loving and pet-friendly home is located within walking distance of Biltmore Village, restaurants, shops, and breweries. Our lives are full of foods, music, and outdoors. We hope your stay in a private room will make your trip memorable! Our home is decorated nicely and always clean. We do have two energetic and friendly dogs that may ask for a rubbin'. If you take a seat on the couch, you'll probably end up with one on either side and some good cuddles and kisses.  **If you are allergic to or despise creatures of the canine variety... unfortunately, this accommodation may not suit you, but we hope that is not the case! Your room is on the second floor with a window facing the backyard. It is furnished with a queen-size bed and a desk. The closet is off limits because we use it for storage, sorry! There are 3 hooks on the wall for hanging things though. The bathroom in the hallway upstairs is for you to use as well. You will be sharing it with Emily but she will stay out of your way
name: Comfortable room in great location!

description: Come stay at our comfortable single family home while you visit quirky, eclectic Asheville famous for her mountains, artists, beer and great food. We have a single family home that offers a possibility of several resident arrangements.  The Peacock Room is on the ground floor near the entrance and on the same level as the living room, kitchen and half bathroom.  The front porch and furnished back deck are available at this level.  The room also has a keyed lock for privacy. Washing machine and dryer are in the unit. There is a shared full bathroom on the upper level of the house.  Also there is a fully equipped shared kitchen/dining room and living room equipped with a flat screen TV hooked to cable with extensive movie channels/ Netflix. We are a friendly couple that are happy to be here for you...and equally satisfied to honor your request for total privacy.  The rooms in the main house if rented individually are more for those travelers seeking interaction with other like minded sou
name: Peacock Room Near Downtown

description: private room in a beautifully furnished new home minutes to Biltmore Village and Downtown.  Comfortable new mattresses, high ceilings, new kitchen and cats to pet.  Two rooms share a dedicated bathroom. Great coffee and nice people! Your room is comfortable and bright when the shades are open. You will have access to your room, bathroom, the living room and kitchen.  We also have a nice backyard. We both work regular jobs, but are friendly and happy to discuss area amenities and stories. We are central to all things Asheville!  7 minutes to downtown, 12 minutes to west Asheville, 5 minutes to Biltmore Village and the Biltmore House, 7 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and its associated trails. There is a bus line running on an adjacent street Fairview Rd. We are not familiar with the lines but certain they are listed online. We have friendly cats, please be nice to them and close all doors leading outside carefully and quickly.  We have lap cats, if you don't want evening visitors jus
name: great room btwn Dwntwn and Biltmore

description: Recently built, this spacious home is nestled in the woods just 15 minutes from downtown Asheville. Enjoy mountain views from the deck or drive 30 minutes to Lake Lure, 15 minutes to downtown AVL, and 10 minutes to the Parkway and Biltmore Estate. Comfortably sleeps 6 and has 2 additional memory foam cots (sheets, pillows and blankets provided). Room for 4 cars - 2 in the front drive and 2 in the back (no street or sidewalk parking available) A small, secluded Asheville neighborhood nestled in the mountains right, outside of town. 51 Winterwind has easy access to the interstate, Blue Ridge Parkway, Lake Lure, downtown Asheville, and more! Short driving distance to some of the biggest attractions in Western North Carolina. The house is located in a secluded neighborhood right off of Highway 74 (or Charlotte Highway) - just 5 minutes from I-40, I-280, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
name: Minutes from AVL! LOW weeknights!

description: Private entrance, full bath, king bed, studio kitchen (stove, refrig, microwave, coffeemaker, toaster) private patio overlooking woods.   2 miles to Biltmore Estate and 3.5 to downtown Asheville. I live upstairs, the apt is separate. You can be in  the mountains or  downtown in minutes and yet  we enjoy a quiet, private neighborhood.  I have lived in Asheville for 21 years and I will do my best to help you make this a wonderful visit. Off street parking.  Patio that is private for the Apartment.  We (2 of us - myself and my husband, Steve) live upstairs.  We have no pets and we do not smoke inside or out.  We ask the same from our guests. We will share our washer and dryer with guests who stay one week or longer. We have provided brochures on all things Asheville for your visit, and as well, we are only a call or text away and happy to help with information. description: Your own comfortable house in historic Grove Park neighborhood. Modern comfortable furnishings, and decorations - no B&B "antiques." Enjoy garden views or explore the food, art and scenery of Asheville.  Newly renovated arts and crafts cottage. Modern open kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom with king size bed, updated bathroom with claw-foot tub.  Queen size air bed and additional linens available upon request. You don't want to stay in a B&B? We don't blame you. No creaking poster bed, knick-knacks or morning conversation. Instead enjoy modern furnishings, Wi-Fi, the owners' contemporary art collection and gourmet coffee. Cottage is situated in one of The Grove Park neighborhood's historic gardens. Cottage has wonderful views, year round and a private porch where you can sit to enjoy them.  Renovation recently completed and there is a full kitchen, but who comes to Asheville to eat in anyhow?  Situated a mile from town - you are close to countless restaurants and shops. If you
name: Guest Cottage in Private Garden

description: Walk to the heart of downtown Asheville in less than 10-minutes!  We are located steps from the minor league baseball field.  Hardwood floors throughout, washer and dryer, shared bathroom (there's only one in the home), likely the best kitchen in Asheville, front porch with a view of the blue ridge mountains, and a fenced in backyard.  In the summer enjoy fresh blueberries, tomatoes and various fresh vegetables from the garden; or, walk to the Saturday farmer's market.   Two rooms are rented via Airbnb or long-term (3-months for traveling nurses and P.T. interns at the hospital), the third room in the home is mine (I live here).  We will consider a well-behaved dog with deposit.  I have one LARGE pooch (85 pounds) currently.   Note: The steps to get up to my house are "steep", with no handrails. You can walk up the driveway and enter in the back of the home (no steps). Please don't park in or block the driveway, unless you need to unload.  I'm a female, outdoor person who loves biking,
name: AA Asheville Walk to Downtown!!

description: The heart of downtown is just a short 15 minute walk away and the Orange Peel venue is only a 13 minute walk away. We love our condo in Downtown Asheville. From our condo, it's an easy stroll to downtown to get a cup of coffee, enjoy dinner or drinks, stroll through an art gallery, or catch a baseball game. We are far enough out, though, that we still get a restful night's sleep.  Please pardon the photo quality. This summer we repainted and refreshed our whole condo. We have homespun pictures at the moment, but are getting higher quality pics soon.  We would love to have you come share our home! You would have your own bedroom with a sunset view looking towards downtown. You would also have access to the kitchen, living room, bathroom, wifi, and parking. Our home is pet-free. The Biltmore Estate is about a 10 minute drive. The Grove Park Inn is about a 10 minute drive. A plethora of restaurants are in 12 minute walking distance or a 5 minute drive. description: Renting rooms in downtown since 2004.  3 blocks from the center of downtown.   Although reservations can span Saturday, we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays. VERY small separate apartment for 1-2 guests.  Full size bed. (A few inches smaller than a Queen) Interior square footage is only around 12 x 12 feet. Kitchenette; refrigerator, sink & coffee maker.  AC & heat temperature is controlled by the guest. A few guests have taken issue with the fact that the bathroom only has a curtain, and no door.  Our guests walk around downtown to the dozens of restaurants, breweries & music venues. They tell us that our location is the most important aspect of their stay. description: Fabulous fully-furnished apartment in downtown A'ville.  Quiet & private with outdoor space, off-street parking . Walk to restaurants, galleries, pubs, theaters, Orange Peel, groceries... all that downtown has to offer!   A real gem!     Garden level 1 bedroom apartment in downtown Asheville. Fully equipped kitchen, private patio, off-street parking.  Quiet, private and safe, yet no need to use your car as you are in the center of town,  Plenty coffee shops, restaurants, art galleries, theaters, and even groceries. Everything recently updated.  New beds and Serta mattress. Secured by ADT security.  2 night minimum. No pets Walking distance to central downtown Asheville, with mountain and city views from huge deck. Located in established family neighborhood with newer residents moving into the area and restoring the homes. Our home is one of the most recently renovated houses and one of the nicest houses on this narrow city street. Neighborhood has survived the many transitions of downtown Asheville, while holding on to the charm of this historic downtown community. Come prepared to live like the locals of downtown Asheville! description: Downtown 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom Apartment With Free Off Street Parking For 2 Cars Finally, there's an answer to champagne tastes on a beer budget: the hip, affordable and new-to-market Ann Street Suite. One of Asheville's freshest rentals, this sweet suite doesn't sacrifice luxury for affordability: bold artwork and stylish furnishings, sprinkled with a helping of modern chic, decorate the apartment – the epitome of Asheville's artsy-cool vibe. Summit the stairs to this top-floor apartment, situated right in the center of Asheville's vibrant arts scene, and open the door to a space bathed in creativity. Pops of color pepper the apartment and metal-mounted graffiti art and local WNC landscape photography decorate the walls. Twin bedrooms offer cushy Tempur-Pedic mattresses – take your pick of king or double -– and the kitchen is outfitted in high-end Ikea. Walk back downstairs, and at your feet are all of Asheville's downtown eateries, art galleries, breweries and cultural destinations.
name: Champagne Tastes on a Beer Budget

The historic Montford and Norwood Park neighborhoods make great morning walks, and there are plenty of local eateries in walking distance as well. Your room is private and quiet with a separate back door entrance with your own parking space off the street.  There is a large back yard with home gardening going on any given time of the year and you are welcome to lounge there all you want! description: Roomy two-story 1917 Craftsman bungalow. Step back in time to 1920's Asheville. From one to four people welcome. Ideal for family or friends getaway. Centrally located on quiet residential street, only a few blocks from restaurants & shops. You and the members of your group will be the only guests at any given time. You will have private use of two adjoining bedrooms and one bath, and access to all the other rooms seen in the photos. This space is ideal for a family group or a group of friends-who-feel-like family and want to save money at the cost of some privacy. You can also save money by preparing meals in the well-equipped kitchen. This is my home, so I'll be sharing the public spaces. Downstairs is a small room with a twin bed, next to a full bathroom. It offers a large private bath right outside the room with a claw foot tub, a king bed, fireplace, original pine mantle, and a heart pine floor.  Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies. The historic architecture and it's convenience to all the attractions of downtown makes your stay a memorable experience. The casual atmosphere along with eclectic furnishings create a relaxed setting for a rejuvenating Asheville stay. description: A ten-minute stroll from downtown Asheville, this charming 1915 Craftsman bungalow is directly across the street from a school playground and three blocks from two major organic supermarkets. A peaceful hideaway in the heart of the city. The house was built in 1915 and features a floor plan in which the kitchen, bathroom, bedrooms, etc. are arranged around the living room, with a hallway for added privacy. So the living room is like the hub of a wheel, and is very much a communal space. Outside, in classic bungalow style, a porch spans the entire front of the house from side to side, providing ample room for a get-together in warm weather. The whole house. I check my guests in and I'm available by text, phone call or email if there are any questions. The neighborhood is known as Murdock Linden, part of the broader North Asheville area, developed in the 1920s; our street was known as Josephine in those days. A very friendly neighborhood, where a smile and nod from every passerby is guar
name: Historical 2 BDR, walk downtown

description: This room is tucked away in the middle of the house for a quiet, cozy stay. Can be booked as a private bath or joined with the Ms Elizabeth room as a suite.  Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies. Continental breakfast includes warm muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit salad. Coffee and beverages are available 24/7.  The historic architecture and it's convenience to all the attractions of downtown makes your stay a memorable experience. The casual atmosphere along with eclectic furnishings create a relaxed setting for a rejuvenating Asheville stay. The inn is walking distance to many shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and bars if you decide to leave your car in our off street parking.
name: Rankin House Inn -Walter Bearden Rm

description: The one bedroom apartment sits at the base of mt Pisgah. Enjoy the quiet of the woods and sounds of the creek while still staying close enough to downtown Asheville to enjoy the art galleries and night life. Lots of fruit and flowers growing here. The best thing about this place is the outdoors. A creek runs through the front yard. There is a fire pit, gas grill and a wood/charcoal grill available for your use. When the weather is warm enjoy the badminton court or some bocce ball. You are just minutes away from the blue ridge parkway and mount Pisgah. There are lots of great hikes and waterfalls within just a few miles of the property.  The bedroom has a queen size bed and there is a fold out couch in the living room which is great for the kids. Be aware there is no cell service here but there is wifi and a landline in the apartment. You have a private entrance and access to the shared laundry room. You are welcome to enjoy all the great features around the property. Play in the creek

description: Built in 1903 and renovated in 2008, our farmhouse has the coziness of an old country home and the vitality of a modern art gallery. A full cascade of windows show off beautiful Hominy Valley and is only 20 minutes from downtown Asheville. Multiple indoor and outdoor sitting areas create opportunities for big parties and intimate conversations. Anne's remarkable collection of modern art and Tom's handmade quilts inhabit the rest of this wonderful gathering space. A horseshoe pit, badminton, bocce balls, and two wonderful swimming holes open up a lifetime of memories. If fishing is your thing, Davis Creek has been restored by the NC Department of Environment and Natural Resources as a protected trout habitat. Mount Pisgah, an easy 1.3 hike and is only 10 minutes away. Feel free to explore the garden and gather what the season has to offer. Our fully appointed modern kitchen has everything the avid cook might need. Whistlepig Farm is available for weddings and events yet different rates
name: Whistlepig Farm

W/D available. Three sites for Tent Camping w/2 adults per tent. Campsites on three wooded acres bordered by babbling brook with fire rings in a wooded area of our organic farm. Bathroom with shower. Kitchen with stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker. (We supply coffee from local micro-roaster.) By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grateful to all of you. Guests are welcome and encouraged to walk all 11 acres of our organic farm, including the woodlot, the creek, and the vegetable fields. description: Cozy room just 20 min to AVL - stunning views. Furnished: Full bed & linens. A/C, Heater, TV w/DVD's. 30 second walk to shared kitchen & bath. Woods! Creek! on Our 11 acre organic farm. We farm vegetables for fine restaurants, co-op, & farm markets. Our farm, our home, is serene and private. We are 20 minutes from downtown Asheville.  The barn room is up 8 steps over the packing house where we prepare and pack vegetables for market.  Most of the upstairs of the packing house is the farm's 'attic' with the Barn Room as a separate 11x17 space that is furnished with full bed/linens, slider chair/footstool, TV w/DVDs, etc.  It was built for root vegetable storage before being converted to a cozy bedroom. Since we have cut back on planting root vegetables, we are able to share this cheery, private room with airBnB guests. It is about 25 yards to the Bathrooms/Showers or to the Kitchen. The Kitchen has stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker; pots, pans, dishes, and flatwar

description: Come stay with us in our beautiful stone home, just 15 min from downtown Asheville. It is in a country neighborhood and you can see the stars at night! Enjoy the gardens, chickens, dog, and cats. We'd love to have you! Kathleen & John Gardens surround this charming homestead with rare trees & shrubs, flowers, and fresh vegetables. The living room wood-burning stove creates a cozy place (in season) to read, talk, or watch a movie. There is off-street parking and a friendly, helpful hostess. We have made quite a few improvements  here lately and the homestead is now even prettier and more comfortable! It may just remind you of your grandmother's house. Many people think that the best things here are the two outdoor covered porches where you can sit and eat, chat, or enjoy a drink.  Outside in the gardens you'll find a hammock, a covered swing, benches, and tables & chairs with umbrellas for your enjoyment.  Your delightful, private, sunny, 2nd floor space has a half-bath right in the roo
name: Stone Cottage Garden Homestay TWO

description: Our guest room has a queen bed, private bath, living area with fold out futon, small fridge, microwave and coffee cart.  There's a large fenced-in back yard and sweet older dog!   We love to host you and make our favorite local recommendations! Our guest bedroom with queen-size bed and living area with a full-size fold-out futon are in the finished basement of our 1940's home.  There is a walk-in private entrance at the back of the house, inside of the fenced yard.  A private bathroom with rustic claw foot tub/shower is stocked with towels and washcloths.  There are extra blankets, pillows and towels in the guestroom closet, an extra queen size air mattress if you'd like to really pack in the guests, as well as a "Pack-n-Play" crib for your use if you're bringing a little one with you.   We have free wi-fi for you to use while you're here, and a desk space if you'd like to get some work done.  There are several bookshelves that you can peruse and borrow from while you're here, as well
name: Private, Cozy and Pet Friendly!

We have made quite a few improvements  here lately and the homestead is now even prettier and more comfortable! It may just remind you of your grandmother's house. Many people think that the best things here are the two outdoor covered porches where you can sit and eat, chat, or enjoy a drink. Open the sliding glass door of the spacious MASTER SUITE  to enjoy the mountain air or relax with a glass of wine on the covered porch.  Sleeping in the LOFT BEDROOM with its own private full bathroom feels like being away from it all, up in the trees.  Guests of all ages enjoy the BUNK ROOM which is adjacent to another full bathroom which features a washer and dryer. The open kitchen /dining / living space with vaulted ceilings and exposed beams is bright and airy during the day and cozy at night with a fire in the danish wood stove. We live only ten minutes from the chalet and we are available to answer any questions,  help you plan your stay and to fix any issues that might occur.
